oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dr. Thomas E. Poag and Unidentified Man at a scout meeting, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 1956, Vol. 1 p.46
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of Dr. Thomas E. Poag, then professor of speech and drama at Tennessee State University and later Dean of Tennessee State University's School of Arts and Sciences, with an unidentified man at a scout meeting for the City Beautiful Commission's "Clean Up, Paint Up, Fix Up" campaign in March of 1956. Dr. Poag was appointed general chairman of the Division 2 of the campaign. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The Commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then a part of the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
